sub_title: Senior Credit Risk Analyst at Lloyds Bank
summary: Experienced in the financial sector from the perspective of both central and commercial banks (both retail and corporate banking). Strong theoretical understanding of the banking system as a whole as well as credit risk management on individual bank levels: stress testing (PRA, EBA, CBES), forecasting, RAS, risk based pricing, usage of IFRS9/IRB models. Climate change related risk management (ESG). Familiarity working with big data (SQL, SAS), dealing with complex tasks and also interpreting and contextualizing the findings in presentations. Also experienced with coordinating tasks and liaising colleagues between departments.

Portfolio analyses from a credit risk perspective. Also monitoring the monetary policy, the developments in banking sector and the whole economy to identify factors that could impact the bank's operation and risk levels. 

Calculating expected credit risk margin and developing its methodology, analyses on its main drivers (default rates, recovery rates, prepayment rates, utilization rates).

Dealing with tasks related to risk based pricing and also conducting analyses on factors (e.g. prepayment behavior of clients) affecting offered interest rate to provide optimal, 'tailor-made' prices to clients. 

Having an understanding on profitability calculation including the concept of contribution margin framework.

Following the developments of IFRS9 credit metrics and the credit quality of both Retail and Corporate loan portfolios in association with monthly risk management report and quarterly report to the Risk Governance Committee (including credit loss allowance, rating migration, stage migration, average PD, DPD, expected risk margins, standard risk costs, NPL movements, coverage ratios). 

Following up on the market risk and operational risk developments, additionally RWA and capital management related issues as well.

Participating in the risk planning process. 

Ad hoc analyses on relevant risk issues. 

Presenting reports to the senior executives, when needed.
